intro: Jacquemontia serrata, commonly known as the prickly pear or desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant has palmate leaves with serrated edges, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along desert margins. Jacquemontia serrata is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
